# Time Entry Status Overview

This guide explains the different statuses a time entry can have in our system.

## Status Lifecycle

Time entries move through several stages from creation to final billing:

### Draft
A time entry starts as a **draft**. This means it has been logged but not yet submitted for review. You can still edit or correct draft entries freely.

### Submitted
Once you're confident your time entry is accurate, you **submit** it for approval. At this stage, the entry is waiting for a manager or project lead to review it.

### Approved
When a manager reviews and confirms the entry is correct, it becomes **approved**. This means the hours are verified and ready to be included in client invoicing.

### Invoiced
After approved entries are included on a client invoice, they are marked as **invoiced**. This indicates the work has been billed to the customer.

### Voided
If a time entry was logged in error or needs to be cancelled, it can be **voided**. Voided entries are not counted toward project hours or billing. Use this status to correct mistakes rather than deleting records, so we maintain a complete audit trail.

## Summary

| Status | Meaning |
|--------|---------|
| Draft | Entered but not yet submitted |
| Submitted | Waiting for manager approval |
| Approved | Verified and ready for billing |
| Invoiced | Included on a client invoice |
| Voided | Cancelled/invalid entry |

---
*For questions about time tracking, contact your project lead or HR.*
